name: Tribal Offerings
description:
Tribal Offerings

Tribal Offerings is a chill god game / strategy game about providing tribes with the resources they need to live. Tribes will in return provide you with offerings allowing you to create more resources.

How To

There will be 3 different tribes (Blue/Water, Green/Wood, Yellow/Ore) that will appear soon after you’ve placed their corresponding resource. Their inhabitants will wander around during the day to bring back resources to their tribe’s houses, then after a hard day of labor get to bed at night. Each tribe is independant, meaning they require all types of resources to survive. They’re also not really friendly, as in if members of two different tribes cross each other’s path they will fight.

There are 3 types of resources, each of them being necessary for the tribes’ survival. :

Water : Drinking is healthy and required for a tribe’s population to survive and grow.

Wood : Wood could be considered as houses’ water, being used to maintain existing houses and allowing for new houses to be build. More houses in a village will allow for an higher population limit.

‘Precious’ Ore : Ore is used to make offerings to the divinity, allowing you to place more resources for them to get. Each tribe will provide you with a specific type of resource.

To place a resource, click on the corresponding resource icon then on the ground. The number of each resource you can place is indicated next to the resource’s icon/button.

Each tribe’s survival is dependant on the others’ as if one of the tribe came to disappear their corresponding resource would not be able to be generated anymore. The key is to manage an access to all three types of resources for each tribe without having them annihilating each other.

Controls Mouse

Interact / Place Resources : Left Click

Cancel current interaction : Right Click

Move Camera : Move mouse towards screen’s edges

Rotate Camera : Hold Middle Click + Move Mouse

Zoom in / out : Scroll

Keyboard

Move Camera : WASD / Arrows

Pause : Escape
